skillTree.localised_description: The slightest glance, the merest glimpse from one of the Dark Gods is sufficient to propel their playthings to ever-greater feats of desolation.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
"Everything has a price — and I’m the one who sets it."

	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: Said to leave a trail of glittering coin upon the waves, this longship's hull is adorned with hammered gold filigree and gromril rivets. Rumour holds it sails faster when coin is near.

effects.description: Grants the Gildwake Longship as ancillary

skillTree.localised_description: Sail, strike, steal. Repeat.

effects.description:
Ability: "Bribewind Raiders" for Marauder units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: His tongue is silver, his purse is full, and his troll is always hungry.
Loyalty is fine, but gold shines brighter.
He calls himself merchant, but his axes are redder than his ledgers.
If there’s profit in it, Eyri will find the way.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 for all Trolls, Fimir and Skin Wolves units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +10 for Norscan Trolls, Bile Trolls, Rotblood Spawn & Norscan Ice Trolls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Grompf follows coin and blood. I give him both."
A coat lined with coins and contracts, blessed by no gods, yet proof against many blades.

effects.description:
Increased plunder from encounters at sea
	(factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: "I trade loyalty like fish. Fresh or rotten — I always make a profit."

effects.description: Allegiance points gained: +20% for alliances and vassalage with Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: “Gold for blood—slay well, and Eyri will see you paid in weight.”

effects.description:
Income from Slaver's Camp buildings: +35%
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: A true son of the coast — fast, ruthless, and unrelenting.
Many are the dark horrors of twisted flesh and nightmares made real that the Ruinous Powers have visited upon the world, but few are quite as vicious.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Don't go anywhere near its mouth - in fact, don't even get within snapping distance if you value your limbs.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who do not bend the knee to the Gods of the North soon find all they hold dear obliterated before them.

skillTree.localised_description: There can be no turning back for those whose souls are turning black.
There is no other choice. There never was.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
That which is not offered up to the Dark Gods of the North in tribute is harvested by their servants for their own petty gain.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
The bleak, brutal landscape of the far north breeds bloody, warlike tribes in thrall to Chaos' delicious, twisted power.
Maybe it is the influence of the Dark Gods that has caused the populace to burgeon and proliferate beyond their natural bounds?
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: "This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

skillTree.localised_description: There's something about the harsh, unforgiving nature of northern life that makes its occupants fight harder and longer than many of their soft, southern equivalents.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruit rank: +2 for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruit rank: +3 for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Something strange - something no scholar really wishes to discover - governs who dies and who lives in the warlike northern wastes.
War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.
The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +200
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: In Eyristaad, loyalty is bought, sold, and often bartered for salted fish. Goldfinger’s wealth has kept the trolls fed, the ships floating, and the blades sharpened. Some claim he’s struck secret pacts with foreign lords, or even daemons. Eyri denies it all — while sipping Bretonnian brandy and calculating interest on war.

effects.description: Bjornlings worship both the gods of men and Chaos, and thus can't pledge full allegiance to a Chaos god.

items.colour_text: Stitched from sailcloth soaked in brine and battle, this banner bears the golden kraken of Eyristaad clutching a balance scale—coin and axe held in equal weight. Salt-encrusted and fraying, it has flown above merchant convoys, sacked ports, and drowned fortresses alike. To Eyri’s allies, it is a promise of profit; to his enemies, a warning that diplomacy may yet come... before the fire. Wherever this standard rises, trade flows, treaties unravel, and someone always ends up paying the price.

Eyri Goldfinger’s infamous twin axes — Coincleavers — are as symbolic as they are deadly. Forged by a disgraced dwarf runesmith deep in the fjords of Norsca, the blades were once part of an unbreakable lockbox made to guard royal tithes. Eyri slew the smith, melted down the box, and reforged it into weapons that would "unlock" the riches of others.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

items.colour_text: Oathgeld & Thumbbite were once wedding rings of a long-dead merchant-lord, cursed to drive their bearer mad with hunger for wealth. Now, they empower Eyri with uncanny agility and a mind honed for deals, plunder, and swift betrayal.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +35%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +35%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "I built a kingdom out of plunder and persuasion. Let eyri choke on it."

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

effects.description: Income from trade tariffs +5% for each confederated Norscan tribe
